attributes.action: ask the Bank of England to introduce a £100 banknote
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: England is the only country in the UK which does not have a £100 note. Scotland and Northern Ireland do. Since 1981 when the fifty pound note was introduced, there has been sufficient inflation to warrant a higher denomination note. The pound coin was launched in 1983 and we already have a two pound coin.
